revised_title: Investigations on Acid Dissolution and Precipitation of Metals
tldr: The author, James Keir, conducted experiments on the dissolution of metals in acids and their precipitation. He discovered a new compound acid that could be useful in separating metals. The author also observed the effects of compounding vitriolic and nitrous acids on the dissolution of metals and the production of gases. This research contributed to the understanding of chemical reactions and the separation of metals in metallurgy.
